channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: UK's Conservatives name Kemi Badenoch as new leader, shifting the party further to the right
item.description: The U.K.'s opposition Conservative Party on Saturday named its new leader, following a long-drawn-out runoff after the Tories' landslide electoral defeat marked a moment of reckoning.

item.title: Why flights to Europe are the cheapest they've been in years
item.description: Airlines have ramped up capacity between the U.S. and Europe in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: The next U.S. president could inherit a booming economy. That's a daunting challenge.
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump both made the economy a focus of their campaign platforms since voters rank it a top priority.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway's cash fortress tops $300 billion as Buffett sells more stock, freezes buybacks
item.description: The Omaha-based conglomerate saw its cash fortress swell to a record $325.2 billion by the end of September.

item.title: Shock poll shows Harris leading Trump in Iowa
item.description: Neither Kamala Harris nor Donald Trump has campaigned in Iowa since the presidential primaries. It is not considered a swing state in the election.

item.title: This European island is likened to the Maldives. I stayed for a week – for $1,500
item.description: Sardinia has white beaches, turquoise sea and plenty of watersports, rather like the Maldives. And it's possible to travel inexpensively there too.

item.title: Record numbers of wealthy Americans are making plans to leave the U.S. after the election
item.description: Attorneys and advisors to family offices and high-net-worth families said they're seeing record demand from clients looking for second passports or long-term residencies abroad.

item.title: Warren Buffett continued to sell down his Apple stake, cutting about a quarter in the third period
item.description: The Oracle of Omaha downsized Apple — his biggest equity holding — for a fourth quarter in a row.

item.title: Companies brace for Tuesday: Mentions of election surge on earnings conference calls
item.description: More companies are talking publicly with investors about the presidential election than in recent cycles.

item.title: Google's cloud outpaces rivals in third quarter as AI battle heats up
item.description: One takeaway from tech earnings reports this week is that Google's cloud business is gaining momentum.

item.title: Nvidia to join Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing rival chipmaker Intel
item.description: Nvidia is replacing Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, a shakeup that reflects a massive change in the semiconductor industry.

item.title: Google employees pressure costumed execs at all-hands meeting for clarity on cost cuts
item.description: Following comments on Google's earnings call about continuing cuts, employees wanted answers at the company's latest all-hands meeting.

item.title: A fast-changing Chinese coffee market awaits Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol
item.description: Here's what new Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol might see when he

item.title: Surge in UK borrowing costs is not a repeat of the 'mini-budget' crisis, economists say
item.description: "It isn't anything like we saw with the Trussonomics mini-budget when that spike really was high after those unfunded tax cuts came in," one analyst said.

item.title: Super Micro's 45% plunge this week wipes out stock's gains for the year
item.description: Super Micro investors have been fleeing for the exits this week after the company lost its second auditor in less than two years.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield rises above 4.3% as traders ignore noisy jobs report
item.description: The 10-year Treasury yield rose higher Friday. The October jobs report showed muted job growth in a month that included hurricanes and a major strike.

item.title: U.S. economy added just 12,000 jobs in October, impacted by hurricanes, Boeing strike
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 100,000 in October, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: China's Zeekr reports EV deliveries in October nearly doubled, clocks its best monthly numbers
item.description: Several major Chinese electric car companies are yet to release deliveries data for October.

item.title: Bank of Japan likely to stay course with a rate hike in December or January, analysts say
item.description: Stefan Angrick, associate director and senior economist at Moody's Analytics, described the tone of the BOJ's Outlook Report as being "moderately" hawkish.

item.title: Federal Reserve rate cuts could prove to be a boon for Southeast Asian economies
item.description: The central banks of both Indonesia and Thailand are attempting to maneuver themselves in the aftermath of the recent Fed cut.

item.title: 25-year-old spent $300 on a sewing machine in high school—now her seven-figure denim brand is worn by Taylor Swift
item.description: EB Denim got its start in a high school locker room.

item.title: Higher taxes will make it harder for Britain to build 'the next Nvidia,' tech execs say
item.description: Startup founders and investors slammed capital gains tax hikes in the U.K., saying it would make it harder for the country to succeed as a global tech hub.

item.title: Chevron beats earnings expectations, returns more than $7 billion to shareholders
item.description: Chevron's stock is largely flat for the year, underperforming the S&P 500 energy sector which has gained more than 6%.

item.title: 33-year-old who left the U.S. to live minutes from the ocean in Jamaica: 'I feel like I have a better chance of longevity here'
item.description: Having moved to Jamaica from North Carolina, "my stress has lifted and I am so much healthier," says "Money Talk with Tiff" podcast host and mom Tiffany Grant.

item.title: Manchester United appoint Ruben Amorim as manager after sacking Erik ten Hag
item.description: English soccer giants Manchester United on Friday confirmed the appointment of Ruben Amorim as their new manager, shortly after sacking Erik ten Hag.

item.title: China’s manufacturing output swings back into expansion in October, private survey finds
item.description: The Caixin/S&P Global manufacturing PMI came in at 50.3 in October, beating the median estimate of 49.7 in a Reuters poll.

item.title: ASEAN continues to emerge as a winner of U.S.-China trade tensions, IMF says
item.description: Southeast Asia has continued to emerge as an economic winner of increasing geopolitical tensions between China and the United States, according to the IMF.

item.title: Apple sales rise 6%, company seeing early iPhone 16 demand
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Big Tech needs to go beyond beating earnings expectations
item.description: Investors don't just expect those companies to beat estimates. They also want Big Tech to drive markets, which depends more on growth prospects than earnings.

item.title: Intel shares jump 7% on earnings beat, uplifting guidance
item.description: Intel reported better-than-expected earnings following a quarter filled with challenges.
